citation.article-title: Isolation and characterization of an anaerobic, cellulolytic bacterium, Clostridium papyrosolvens sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Clostridium papyrosolvens sp. nov.
Clostridium papyrosolvens (L. noun papyrus paper; L. verb solvere to dissolve; M.L. adj. papyrosolvens paper-dissolving; intended to reflect the organism’s ready fermentation of filter paper)
Straight rods, 0.5 to 0.8 μm by 2.0 to 5.0 μm.
Deep colonies in cellulose agar are 1 to 2 mm in diameter, granular, and unpigmented.
Slight growth occurs in nutrient broth without fermentable carbohydrate; moderate growth occurs in the presence of a fermentable carbohydrate.
Fermentation products include ethanol, acetate, lactate, hydrogen, and carbon dioxide.
Found in an estuarine anaerobic sediment.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the DNA is 30 mol%.
Type strain: National Collection of Industrial Bacteria strain NCIB 11394.
Since the species is based on a single strain, the type strain, the description of the type strain is the same as that given above for the species.
